net.proteusframework.core.hibernate

Class HibernateSessionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.hibernate.HibernateSessionHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HibernateSessionAcceptor

    @HibernateSessionAcceptorConfig(value="hibernateSessionHelper")
public class HibernateSessionHelper
extends java.lang.Object
implements HibernateSessionAcceptor
    Helper class for implementing the HibernateSessionAcceptor. This class also may be extended as it implements that interface. This class handles potential thread safety issues of hibernate sessions and provides a mechanism for nesting hibernate transactions properly.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • beginTransaction

        public void beginTransaction()
        Calls beginTransaction(FlushMode) with an argument of null meaning to perform the default behavior.

      • beginTransaction

        public void beginTransaction(@Nullable org.hibernate.FlushMode flushMode)

        Begin a transaction. This will automatically set the FlushMode for the session to AUTO for the duration of the transaction if it is currently NEVER, MANUAL or COMMIT. If a transaction is already in process for this thread it will continue to be used.

        IMPORTANT: For EVERY CALL to this method, the implementation must either call commitTransaction() or rollbackTransaction() or recoverableRollbackTransaction(). rollbackTransaction() calls MAY follow commitTransaction() calls. HOWEVER commitTransaction() calls MAY NOT follow rollbackTransaction() or recoverableRollbackTransaction() calls.

        This is required because a transaction cannot be committed once it has been partially rolled back. BUT it can be rolled back if nested transactions allow a commit since the nesting transaction supersedes all nested transactions.

        This pattern can easily be followed if all code follows the pattern: 
             HibernateSessionHelper helper = ... somehow get the same helper
                                     ... as nesting transactional calls
     boolean success = false;
     helper.beginTransaction();
     try
     {
         ... do transactional things
         ... possibly calling nested transactions
         ... that follow this same pattern
         success = true;
     }
     finally
     {
         if(success) helper.commitTransaction();
         else
         {
            // If its known that failure was NOT due to an exception thrown by the Session,
            // then it may be desirable to call helper.recoverableRollbackTransaction() here
            // to allow the Session to continue to be used.
            helper.rollbackTransaction();
         }
     }
        Parameters:
        flushMode - the requested flush mode, may be null for default behavior.

      • clearSession

        public void clearSession()
        Description copied from interface: HibernateSessionAcceptor
        Clear an existing session. The session should not be closed. No exception should be thrown if no session is set.
        Specified by:
        clearSession in interface HibernateSessionAcceptor

      • commitTransaction

        public void commitTransaction()
                       throws TransactionPreviouslyRolledBackException
        Commit transaction. If the beginTransaction() has been called multiple times since the last commit, then this method will do nothing. The last commitTransaction() will commit the transaction IFF rollbackTransaction() has not been called anywhere along the chain. If this method is called AFTER a point in the chain where rollbackTransaction() has been called, a TransactionPreviouslyRolledBackException will be thrown. This is required because a partially rolled back transaction cannot be committed.
        Throws:
        TransactionPreviouslyRolledBackException - if a nested transaction
        See Also:
        for an example of proper use and more complete discussion. has already called {@link #rollbackTransaction()} on the current transaction.

      • flushAndClearSession

        public static void flushAndClearSession(org.hibernate.Session session)
        Flush and clear the session. This flushes hibernate's action queue and evicts all items from the 2nd level cache.
        Parameters:
        session - the session.

      • flushSession

        public static void flushSession(org.hibernate.Session session)
        Flush the session, including hibernate's action queue.
        Parameters:
        session - the session.

      • isInTransaction

        public boolean isInTransaction()
        Return true if the code is in a transaction.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • recoverableRollbackTransaction

        public void recoverableRollbackTransaction()
        Rollback the transaction due to a recoverable error. A transaction is rolled back on the FIRST call to this method. Any subsequent calls to this method is a no-op as the transaction has been already been rolled back. It IS, however, imperative that once a nested transaction has been rolled back all nested transactions must also call rollbackTransaction() or recoverableRollbackTransaction() (NOT commitTransaction()) to maintain the bookkeeping of a transaction per session.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not in a transaction.
        See Also:
        for an example of proper use and more complete discussion.

      • rollbackTransaction

        public void rollbackTransaction()
        Rollback the transaction due to an unrecoverable error (like any exception thrown by the hibernate session). A transaction is rolled back on the FIRST call to this method. Any subsequent calls to this method is a no-op as the transaction has been already been rolled back. It IS, however, imperative that once a nested transaction has been rolled back all nested transactions must also call rollbackTransaction() or recoverableRollbackTransaction() (NOT commitTransaction()) to maintain the bookkeeping of a transaction per session.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not in a transaction.
        See Also:
        for an example of proper use and more complete discussion.

      • setSession

        public void setSession(org.hibernate.Session session)
        Description copied from interface: HibernateSessionAcceptor
        Set the session. The session should be set in a thread local. If there is an existing session, it should be closed and replaced with this session.
        Specified by:
        setSession in interface HibernateSessionAcceptor
        Parameters:
        session - the session.
